Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
CAN: The student may draw generic plant shapes with some green color, suggesting some awareness that plants are typically green (basic feature).
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to differentiate between plants with and without water in terms of wilting or dryness (may draw all plants looking the same).
The student is unlikely to show any differences due to lack of light, such as pale coloring or stunted growth (no concept of light's effect).
The student probably cannot illustrate specific effects of water or light on plant health (does not understand causation).
The student might not use any patterns or visual differences to convey the importance of water and light (no visual contrast).
